title: Sum of Digits Times Seven
description:
Sum of Digits Times Seven

Given an integer n, calculate the sum of all its digits, then multiply the result by 7.

Examples:

  • Input: 123
    Output: 42
    Explanation: (1 + 2 + 3) × 7 = 6 × 7 = 42
  • Input: 999
    Output: 189
    Explanation: (9 + 9 + 9) × 7 = 27 × 7 = 189
  • Input: 0
    Output: 0

Constraints:

  • Handle single digits and multiple digits
  • Non-negative integers
solution_text:
Sum of Digits Times Seven

Algorithm:

  1. Convert number to string to iterate digits
  2. Sum all digits
  3. Multiply by 7

Time Complexity: O(d) - where d is number of digits

Space Complexity: O(1) - constant space

Key Insights:

  • String conversion simplifies digit extraction (vs modulo/division)
  • Generator expression with sum() is memory efficient
  • Each character digit needs int() conversion to perform addition
  • Number of digits ≈ log₁₀(n), very small even for large numbers
